intro: Senebiera coronopus, commonly known as the crown-of-thorns plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that store water, aiding in its survival in arid environments. Its showy yellow or orange flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, giving it a striking appearance. Senebiera coronopus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms.
